title.narrative: Project Development Support Livelihood For Displaced and Hosts in the Region of Diffa

description.narrative: to support the development of livelihoods for 700 households including displaced and host households distributed in four departments of Diffa. The project also involved providing support to Diffa vocational and technical training center for the training of 56 young people in four sectors including auto mechanics, metallic carpentry, joinery and plumbing. A socioeconomic study was conducted in order to collect data on the socio-economic lifestyle that can be used in planning assistance programs to these populations. - Identification and registration of beneficiaries in collaboration with UNHCR, other actors in the field, community leaders, municipalities, the DREC-R, based on vulnerability; - Organization of solidarity groups as interests or business sectors (agriculture, livestock, Learning crafts, Crafts, Retailing, Transport). - Implementation of training sessions for solidarity groups (Groups of beneficiaries). - Supporting solidarity groups in developing their streamlined business plan. - Financing simplified business plans in two tranches in a 60.000FCFA rate per beneficiary. - Monitoring and support solidarity groups in the implementation of their activities. - Realization of participatory assessments on progress made by each group of solidarity in the implementation of its SIP (AGR).
